page.title: 02WILDLIFE IN KILTARLITY AREA
page.content: Kiltarlity has a varied and interesting{wildlife}:deer,rabbits, foxes,hares,badgers,wildcats,bats,gras s snakes and adders.There are many {birds}of prey (eagles,owls buzzards and other hawks) and game birds (grouse,pheasants,partridges and pigeons)are reared for shooting. Three species of deer can be found in local forests and woodlands.Rabbits in this area are almost pests.Foxes are only to be seen near woods and fields. Late at night,badgers are occasionally seen.Wildcats too,and bats,can be seen at night.Some rare birds of prey such as marsh and hen harriers and snowy owls can be seen.The varied habitats include moorland,forest,marsh and cultivated land which support a large variety of small{mammals}and birds.The area is also notable as a resting place for many migrating birds.
